articles.author: Ron Bousso
articles.description: Shell (SHEL.L) CEO Wael Sawan has come under pressure over his strategy from within the energy company after two employees issued a rare open letter urging him not to scale back investments in renewable energy, sparking an internal debate.
articles.title: Exclusive: Shell CEO comes under pressure from within on renewables shift

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hyundai (005380.KS) and Kia (000270.KS) are recalling about 1.6 million and 1.7 million vehicles respectively in the U.S. due to risk of an engine compartment fire, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Wednesday.
articles.title: South Korea's Kia, Hyundai recall millions of vehicles in US - NHTSA

articles.author: Mike Scarcella
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission's lawsuit accusing Amazon.com (AMZN.O) of abusing its retail market power to stifle competition faces hurdles in court, testing the scope of U.S. antitrust law and posing roadblocks for the agency, legal experts said.
articles.title: FTC's Amazon antitrust lawsuit faces high bar in US court -experts

articles.author: Hannah Lang
articles.description: Crypto companies are descending on Capitol Hill on Wednesday, but their push to advance industry-friendly laws is likely to be overshadowed by a fight over the federal budget and a Senate crackdown on the use of crypto for money laundering.
articles.title: Analysis: US crypto industry comes to Washington, but faces uphill struggle

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's cyberspace regulator on Wednesday released the first batch of mobile app stores that have completed filing business details to regulators as it enforces a new set of rules to expand oversight on mobile apps.
articles.title: China enforces new filing rules on smartphone app stores

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf, David Randall, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: As the Federal Reserve’s hawkish stance boosts Treasury yields and slams stocks, some investors are preparing for more pain ahead.
articles.title: Analysis: Harsh reality of 'higher-for-longer' rates looms over US stocks

articles.author: Pete Schroeder, Michelle Price, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: U.S. financial firms are pushing for greater clarity on proposed new rules curbing U.S. investments in some China technology sectors which they say are too vague and put the onus of compliance on investors.
articles.title: US investors want clarity on Biden's vague curbs on China tech

articles.author: Scott Murdoch, Julie Zhu, Rae Wee
articles.description: The chairman of China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) has been placed under police surveillance, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, raising more doubts about the embattled developer's future as it grapples with mounting prospects of liquidation.
articles.title: Evergrande chairman under police watch; liquidation risk mounts

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump's rivals are running out of time to halt his march to the 2024 Republican presidential nomination unless one emerges as a clear alternative in their second debate on Wednesday, party strategists say.
articles.title: Time running out for Trump's Republican 2024 rivals as they face off in second debate

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea has decided to expel American soldier Travis King who it said has admitted to illegal intrusion into the country and was "disillusioned about unequal U.S. society," state media KCNA said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Travis King: North Korea to expel US soldier over illegal border crossing
